Production Center: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Production Center  NYU boasts one of the largest filmmaking facilities on the Eastern Seaboard, serving the needs of both our Undergraduate and Graduate film and video students. The facility is run by 11 full-time staff members and over 50 technical assistants that are both technically and professionally trained in many technical and aesthetic aspects of film production, including: film planning and production, equipment operation, equipment maintenance and repair.    The Production Center supports every aspect of the well-over 4,500 student projects shot every year, with technical seminars, industry-professional equipment, film stock and supplies, equipment repair services, and additional support for planning and development of student films. The equipment packages vary by level of study (fundamental through advanced/thesis), and are available to students enrolled in production courses. the production center consists of 5 areas which include the Advanced and Fundamental Equipment Areas, Repair Shop, Equipment Reservations Office, and the Production Office, which provides the students with the supplies and resources needed to produce a film or video. The department creates video content that advances your strategic communications goals in areas such as recruitment, student affairs, development, alumni relations and public relations. Media Production also advises clients on how to best use video creatively for the web, social networking platforms, events, presentations, conferences, campaigns and recruitment programs.        Media Production is a full-service group that handles all aspects of production from inception to final delivery, including development, strategic planning, writing, shooting, interviewing, animation, editing and archiving as well as research and licensing for music, photography, and stock footage. The department also maintains an extensive archive of NYU and New York City material for use in a variety of projects.   As fellow members of the NYU community , Media Production has an understanding of your needs and interests – and the needs and interests of your audience – that is unparalleled. Their team of award-winning professionals is at your service to ensure that you have the best possible products to advance your program, department or school.
